feed.title: SAP Community - Governance, Risk, Compliance (GRC), and Cybersecurity

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors SoD Matrix for SAP GRC
entry.content:
Hello,

We are connection SAP SuccessFactors with SAP GRC Access Control to analyses the possible SoD conflicts.

Actually, SAP doesn't provide any standard Matrix or example on how to create it. Since it doesn't follow the permissions/accesses style of an ERP, does anyone have any matrix or examples of how permissions should be included in the tool?

Thanks in advanced,

Regards.

entry.title: Segragation of roles based on Organizational values
entry.content:
Hello!

How do you analyze/ check on the organizational values/ levels if the two businesses of the client are segragated? Any insights/comments will be much appreciated.

Thank you.

entry.title: WAPD GRC_PC_ISSUM is inactive
Can the LDAP system be used for user details but ignored/not shown in provisioning requests
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to ignore the LDAP connector in provisioning requests (model user, terminations etc.) but still use the connector for user details.

Currently, the LDAP system is selectable for systems and termination requests.  (It is read only for the implementation.)

is this possible?

entry.title: Hello GRC Community,
entry.content:
Hello GRC Community,

I'm Benita, and I'm excited to join this group and start engaging with fellow professionals who are passionate about SAP GRC. I‚Äôve had the opportunity to gain some hands-on experience with access controls, audit management, and user provisioning in SAP environments. More recently, I‚Äôve been exploring how AI and automation are starting to enhance compliance processes and improve risk detection.

As I continue to grow in this space, I‚Äôm looking to connect with others working across different areas of GRC.

    I‚Äôd love to hear from you:

  • What part of GRC are you currently involved in‚Äîaccess control, risk management, audit, compliance, or something else?

  • Are there any groups within the SAP community (or outside of it) that you‚Äôve found especially helpful for learning or collaboration?

  • And how is AI showing up in your space‚Äîif at all?

Looking forward to the conversations, insights, and connections. Thank you for welcoming me into the community!

Warm regards,
Benita

entry.title: Which Client to operate "SAP Access Control for S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition in", 000 or ?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

this is a question about Client 000 and SAP Access Control for S/4HANA Private Edition.

Introduction & Background:

SAP Access Control for S/4HANA Private Edition documentation is here: 

SAP Access Control for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition 

and this documentation points to

-> Digital Library

which points to

-> SAP Access Control | SAP Help Portal

I don't see any recommendation or best practice in the documentation regarding which Client to operate Access Control in, and whether or not to use the default Client 000.

Question:

When we install the Access Control "System", the Access Control functionality by default is running in Client 000.

With SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition, the Customer is restricted on what they can do in Client 000 as SAP ECS own and manage Client  000  

SAP_HANA_USER_MANAGEMENT_ABAP_Client_000.pdf

And so the question, when we implement/deploy SAP Access Control on S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition, what is the "best practice recommendation from SAP" regarding the Client where Access Control is operating, should we operate Access Control on Client 000, or, should we operate Access Control in another Client, in a similar as is described for operating Process Control in a different Client 1505255 - Transfer client-specific Customizing for PC/RM 10.0 - SAP for Me

The worry is, if we operate Access Control in Client 000 on S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition, since SAP ECS own Client 000, operating Access Control in 000, due to the Segregation of Duties between ECS and the Customer, operating Access Control could become difficult and complex.

What is the recommendation from SAP and other people's experience ?

Thanks and best regards,

Andy Silvey.

tagging:

@ElyasAhmed 

@T_Frenehard

entry.title: Is GRC 12 Unicode system will support Non-Unicode ERP Plugin system?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Is GRC 12 NW Unicode system will support Non-Unicode ERP Plugin system?

NW 7.52 with GRC 12 System (GRCFUND_A_V1200) is standalone GRC Unicode system

EHP7 for ERP 6 with GRC 12 plugin(GRCPINW V1200_750 0028 SAPK-V1228INGRCPINW) Non-Unicode system.

Is there any Compatibility issues with respective Unicode GRC and Non-Unicode ERP plugin system?

#GRC12,#EHP7 ERP

Thanks

Ramesh

entry.title: GRC 2026 vs GRC S4HANA
entry.content:
Hi we have a question in regards to SAP GRC 2026 and GRC S4/HANA. 

First of we are wondering if its it possible to run GRC 2026 With S4HANA on plugin systems. Is it possible to have mix of systems? 

 

Furthermore is GRC 2026 able to do risk analysis for fiori tiles? 

Finally What is recommended if we are upgrading to S4HANA on other systems.  To use GRC 2026 or Upgrade the grc to s4hana suite.

entry.title: Cyber Security
entry.content:
I have learnt a lot of things in this course. Cybersecurity is one of the most trending topics in today‚Äôs technology & market. We cannot imagine our life without Cybersecurity. Data protection is one of the major features of Cyber security.
In today‚Äôs technology world, threat comes from various sources. There are many forms of the threats which is causing Data Leak and is compromising the safety of Data. Having some suitable techniques to counter the same will definitely lead to more enhanced solution for the client and other techniques.

 

I learnt about the Cybersecurity techniques like Firewall, Anti Malware, Anti-Virus, Penetration Testing, Network security monitoring and other tools.

 

Firewalls mostly help in monitoring like which data is incoming and outgoing. It tries to stop the unwanted data from passing by adding some validations rules based on which it can filter whether the data is valid or not. This technique is one of the best techniques for the Cybersecurity.

 

Anti Malware is a trending tool in Cybersecurity as it prevents malware from attacking the Computer and other important software systems. Most of them are Behavior based tools while others are signature based tool.

The Behavior based tool checks for the behavior of the Malware and tries to prevent it from entering the computing system. Hence, it tries to save the cyber world from a potential threat.

The Signature based approach mainly deals with protection based on signature mechanism. This is also a very important approach in the world of Cybersecurity.

 

Anti Virus is an important tool in the world of Cybersecurity. It is a kind of software mechanism which tries to block any kind of the Virus which can pass to the Important computing systems through the malicious softwares, applications, and other hardware devices like pendrives, compact disks, etc. In this mechanism, the cyber security people have to keep the Anti virus updated everytime so that it does not expire.

 

Penetration testing is an important scenario in Cybersecurity. This is a method of testing in the world of Cybersecurity. It is a method to test the Weakness of the system. It tests which part is the Strongest and which is the weakest part in the system. In case of any security breach, this tool is the most effective tool. Many people also call it as a way of Ethical hacking.

 

Network Security Monitoring is also an important technique for the Cybersecurity monitoring. In this technique, the network is quietly monitored using various techniques.

It is used to monitor how the data is moving and how it is getting transmitted from one medium to another and if there is any kind of threat or malware in that message. If there is any threat, it will block the threat using various mechanisms like SNMP which is Simple Network Management Protocol which is used to check the Status of the devices and monitor them.

 

Few of the Challenges of the Cyber Security is that since it is the age of Artificial Intelligence, the Cyber Attacks are increasing day by day. Every other day, we hear about the new Cyber threats arising which is very much disturbing.

Hence, we need to find new techniques and update ourselves so that we can save our future from the Cyber-attacks and threats. We have to enhance our knowledge using the latest techniques to secure our systems from Cyber Attacks.

entry.title: GRC BRM - Digital signature enablement Option is not seen
entry.content:
Dear SAP community, We are currently implementing BRM (Business Role Management) for a client and are looking to enable digital signature functionality during workflow approvals ‚Äî specifically, we require approvers to enter their user ID and password when approving requests in their work inbox (similar to how it functions in ARM - Access Request Management).

However, we are unable to locate the "Digital Signature Enablement" option within BRM configuration. Could you please advise on how we can achieve the similar functionality in BRM. Please share the SAP note or configuration steps if available.

Thank you.

entry.title: Roles in GRC returning from Production to Development automatically
entry.content:
Hello!

How can I avoid the roles in GRC returning from Production to Development status every time I update any other field and save the changes?

Every time I update any field in a role, such as Role Owner, it returns to Development status in the Provisioning tab. And I have to update manually to Production status again. This happens when I update the role from NWBC -> Access Management -> Role Search.

#GRC #Access Control #Role Management

entry.title: Derived role status in GRC BRM is not same as Master role after the approval step is completed
entry.content:
Dear SAP community,

The status of the master role and the derived roles is inconsistent. The master role is set to Completed after approval; however, the derived roles are not reflecting the same Completed status.Could you please advise what is the issue here.

Thanks.

entry.title: Should the "User Level Simulation" results show "User does not exist" result?
entry.content:
We use SAP GRC Access Control V1200 SP24 connecting to SAP S/4HANA 2023 SP01.  We are finding an inconsistency with the results when running Risk Analysis "User Level" versus "User Level Simulation" options.

The user does not have an SAP account in S/4.

When running the "User Level" option, the formats Summary and Detail show "User does not exist" which is expected. The formats Management Summary and Executive Summary are both blank. 

When running the "User Level Simulation" option, the formats Summary and Detail show "No Violations" and the other two are blank.

Logically, shouldn't the Simulation also show the user does not exist?

entry.title: Firefighter needs 02 activity to reset FFID password (Decentralized)
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I have an issue to report. Our GRC system was working fine until one day when the users started to encounter login issue with FFID. When they try to login into FFID, they get a login screen which asks for the credentials.

Error shows "You are not authorized to change users in group XXXX"

After investigation, we found that users are missing authorization for S_USER_GRP with 02 activity. However, the same was working 1 day before with 03 and 05 activity.

Our analysis says usually a logical destination is created in SM59 when the user tries to login into FFID, and the password reset happens for the FFID assigned to user and then the user can then login into FFID.

In Sandbox and Dev, Users can still login with 03 and 05 activity but in Test and Prod , the password reset is asking for 02 activity.

 

Can someone help what could have happened all of a sudden?

 

SAP GRC Access Enforcer for SAP NetWeaver Governance, Risk, Compliance (GRC) and Cybersecurity SAP GRC Firefighter for SAP NetWeaver

entry.title: Session Details not updated in FF Log
entry.content:
Hello,

We are using Decentralized FF in our GRC. We access the FF in the plug-in system (ECC) , and the log and workflow jobs are scheduled and running without any issue. Logs are collected, but the session details are not updated in the FF log, and the workflow is not triggered. We can see that the status of the workflow is reported as WF status cannot be determined in GRAC_FFSESSION. 

But as a workaround , if we cancel the workflow and start new work for the FF session, the workflow is triggered.

GRC:

GRCFND_A V8100 0027
GRCPINW V1200_750 0027

ECC:

GRCPINW V1100_731 0028

Has anyone encountered a similar issue? Could you kindly share your insights?

Thanks and Regards,

Raaj Mohan

entry.title: Error During MSMP Workflow Generation ‚Äì Object ID Initial or Unknown
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I‚Äôm currently configuring an MSMP Workflow in GRC Access Control (Access Request Approval Workflow), and I‚Äôm facing an issue at Step 7 of 7 (Generate Versions). When I try to activate the workflow version, I get the following error:

ID 171F2A42B1921FD09993DA2E870F395E is initial, unknown, or it does not have the correct object type

üõ†Ô∏è What I‚Äôve done so far:

  • Created and maintained custom paths and stages (Custom Path, GRAC_MANAGER)

  • Configured rules, variables, agents, and route mapping

  • Maintained BRF+ rules and activated the application

  • Assigned initiator and checked agent rules in MSMP config

‚úÖThe following validations passed:

  • Process Path: SAP_GRAC_ACCESS_REQUEST

  • Stage: GRAC_MANAGER validation began successfully

  • BRF+ Decision table and function simulation works as expected.

‚ùåThe main blocker is this Object ID error which is not pointing clearly to any specific config step or missing object.

üì∑Screenshot: (Attached ‚Äì showing error in step 7)

Has anyone faced this before?

  • Is it related to a missing or inactive BRF+ rule, initiator, or stage ID?

  • Could it be an issue with an invalid agent rule or context parameter?

Any guidance or steps to debug this object ID error would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your help!

Regards,
Ankit Singh

entry.title: Generate EAM log for Firefighter sessions with no activity - 4020 parameter
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am aware of 4020 parameter in SPRO (GRC). If set to Yes, it will generate EAM log and send it to Controller even if there is no activity.

Currently I have changed it to NO in my System but still the logs are getting sent to the controller's inbox.

Steps that i am doing -

login into FF user in plugin system , Hit Tcode /n/GRCPI/GRIA_EAM, Select reason code and list of actions, Initiate the session but not hit any tcode and exit session.

entry.title: SAP Governance
entry.content: How to add dynamically options to choice field using script task in process governance process section

entry.title: Need Best Practices of ABAP Access to Production Environment
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team

 

Our external auditors have raised a concern that they will not rely on SAP for the financial audit. The issue identified is that the ABAP user currently has access to the production environment, which they consider a violation of control.

 

In light of the above, I request your support in providing the relevant SAP standards or best practices on this matter, preferably referenced in an SAP Note. This is critical, as the system was implemented primarily for financial controlling, and the auditors‚Äô non-reliance on SAP for financials would undermine its purpose.

 

Your prompt response will be highly appreciated.

 



Thanks

entry.title: GRC access control - update user role assignment after backend role deletion
entry.content:
Hello,

we have implemented ARQ/ARM and BRM to provision business role in backend system.

how to align or reconcile Access Control User role assignment, if we delete a technical role assigned directly in the backend system  for user A?

program GRAC_UPDATE_BR_ASSIGNMENT do not display any data for this user A( so on the Access Control Business Role Mass Update Background Job job).

program GRAC_CHECK_BROLE_ASSIGNMENT till display all business role/technical role.

kind regards
